metadata.title: CVE-2019-17594 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the _nc_find_entry function intinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
libncurses6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
libncursesw6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
libtinfo6 - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1+20191019-1ubuntu1').
